intro: Hieracium binzii, commonly known as the Alpine Groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium binzii is often found in mountainous areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
